Tabs

Requirements

The toggles must have data-cosmui="tab".

Set the tab pane #id in the href (or data-target) of the respective toggle.

Use a <ul> for the toggles.

Notes

An .active will be set in the tab pane and toggle's <li>.

notice You don't need to use the structure in the code sample, just meet the requirements. The sample is simply an out of the box solution with styling and semantic elements.

  • Section 1
  • Section 2

Use it as .box tabs

Howdy, I'm in Section 2.

Inside a Box
  • Section 1
  • Section 2
  • Section 3

I'm in Section 1.

Howdy, I'm in Section 2.

Section 3.

  • Section 1
  • Section 2
  • Nested Section 1
  • Nested Section 2

I'm in Nested Section 1.

Howdy, I'm in Nested Section 2.

Howdy, I'm in Section 2.

<ul class="nav-tabs">
  <li class="active">
    <a href="#tab-1" data-cosmui="tab"><!-- Title --></a>
  </li>
  <li>
    <a href="#tab-2" data-cosmui="tab"><!-- Title --></a>
  </li>
</ul>
<div class="tab-content">
  <section class="tab-pane active" id="tab-1">
    <!-- Content -->
  </section>
  <section class="tab-pane" id="tab-2">
    <!-- Content -->
  </section>
</div>

Buttons

Button Groups

very important In order for the buttons to be properly close together, don't set any white space between them, it should be </button><button>.

Alerts

Inline Alerts

× Success Your settings were saved succesfully.
× Warning Your settings might not have been saved.
× Error Your settings could not be saved.
× Info Your settings are currently being processed.

Block Alerts

× Success Your settings were saved succesfully.
× Info

Your settings might not have been saved.

<div class="alert [alert-block] alert-[success, warning, error, info]" data-cosmui="alert">
  <a class="close">&times;</a>
  <strong class="alert-heading icon icon-[success, warning, error, info]">
    <!-- Alert Title -->
  </strong>
  <!-- Alert Content -->
</div>

You can do it programatically too, using cosmUI.alert.close( [alert div(s)] ):

Toggler

Toggle anything

The Toggler plugin essentially allows you to show/hide any element(s) you wish, in a very simple way.

Requirements

As with all other components, you need data-cosmui="toggler". You also need to indicate the element(s) you wish to toggle with either href="#[id]" or data-target="[CSS selector]". That's all you need to do, when the toggle is clicked, the target will either open or close depending on current state.

Options

Opener data-cosmui="toggler opener" - the toggle will only open the target
Closer data-cosmui="toggler opener" - it will only close the target
Animation data-animation="[showHide, fade, slide]" - choose which animation will be used to toggle the element, the default is 'slide'

Events

Open
cosmui.toggler.open
cosmui.toggler.open-before
cosmui.toggler.open-after
Close
cosmui.toggler.close
cosmui.toggler.close-before
cosmui.toggler.close-after
How to use events
$(yourTargetElement).on('cosmui.toggler.close-before', yourFunction() );

Sample Code

<button data-cosmui="toggler" data-target="#toggler h2" class="button">
  <!-- Toggle Text -->
</button>

Examples

You can use it in any element you want! Pretty sweet.

Accordion

It's easy to make an accordion with the Toggler component by specifying a parent and it's children.

Parenting

  • data-parent="[CSS selector]"
  • data-children="[CSS selector]"

By indicating a parent with data-parent in the Toggler, when it is clicked all elements within the specified data-children will be closed.

Tooltips

It's Peanuts

Get a tooltip in just two easy steps:

  1. data-cosmui="tooltip" on the element
  2. title="" attribute for tooltip content.
  3. optional data-gravity with:
    nw | n | ne | w | e | sw | s | se (compass)
    to position your tooltip where you want it.

Examples

Hover me

Hover on the right

<span data-cosmui="tooltip" [data-gravity="w"] title="Tooltip content">Hover me</span>

Modal

Launch Modal

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nullam in dui mauris. Vivamus hendrerit arcu sed erat molestie vehicula. Sed auctor neque eu tellus rhoncus ut eleifend nibh porttitor. Ut in nulla enim. Phasellus molestie magna non est bibendum non venenatis nisl tempor. Suspendisse dictum feugiat nisl ut dapibus. Mauris iaculis porttitor posuere. Praesent id metus massa, ut blandit odio. Proin quis tortor orci. Etiam at risus et justo dignissim congue. Donec congue lacinia dui, a porttitor.

Save changes Close

Quick & Easy

  1. Call the cosmui.modal.js file after cosmui.js near the end of the body tag
  2. Stick a .modal class and an id on your a box element
  3. To use an element to open a modal, you need to add two things to it:
    1. Set data-cosmui="modal"
    2. Use href or data-target with the id of the modal

Auto-open

In case you want to share a link to a modal, you simply need to share the link as you would for any anchor, with an hash with the id of the modal, i.e. like this

Notes

If you want to add buttons inside the modal that can close it, just add data-close="modal".

The sample code is not the required code for the component to work, it's an easy to copy structure to jumpstart the use.

Sample Code

<!-- Modal Toggle -->
<a class="button primary" data-cosmui="modal" href="#myModal">
  <!-- Toggle Text -->
</a>

<!-- Modal Box -->
<article class="box modal" id="myModal">        
  <header class="box-header"> <!-- [Optional] Header -->
    <a class="close">&times;</a>
    <h3 class="box-header-title"><!-- Your Title --></h3>
  </header>
  <div class="box-content">
    <!-- 
      Your Content 
    -->
    <footer> <!-- [Optional] Action Buttons -->
      <a href="#" data-close="modal" class="button">Close</a>
    </footer>
  </div>
</article>

Methods

Open cosmUI.modal.open( $(yourModal) )
Close cosmUI.modal.close( $(yourModal) )
Re-assign events cosmUI.modal.reload()

If you need a custom method, submit as an issue on github if you think it's re-usable or consider extending the plugin.

Events

Open
cosmui.modal.open
cosmui.modal.open-before
cosmui.modal.open-after
Close
cosmui.modal.close
cosmui.modal.close-before
cosmui.modal.close-after
How to use events
$(yourModal).on('cosmui.modal.close-before', yourFunction() );

Range

Range slider

The Range plugin allows you to transform a select box into an accessible value slider.

Requires only 2 things

  1. Load the script cosmui.range.js
  2. Add data-cosmui="range" to the <select>

Events

cosmui.range.created
Triggers when the element is created and inserted in the DOM.
Arguments
event : the jQuery event object
obj : an object containing information about the created element.
cosmui.range.change
Triggers when the value in the slider changes.
To avoid too many change events, sequential events never happen in less than 500ms.
Arguments
event : the jQuery event object
value : the value to which the slider changed to, corresponding to the value of the select box <option>
How to use events
$(yourSelectElement).on('cosmui.range.change', yourFunction(e,value) );

Example

Sample Code

<select class="graph-duration" data-cosmui="range">
  <option value="300">5 minutes</option>
  <option value="1800">30 minutes</option>
  <option value="3600">1 hour</option>
  <option value="10800">3 hours</option>
  <option value="86400" selected="selected">1 day</option>
  <option value="604800" >1 week</option>
  <option value="2592000">30 days</option>
  <option value="7776000">3 months</option>
  <option value="15552000">6 months</option>
  <option value="31536000">1 year</option>
</select>
